intro: Rytigynia affinis, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a small to medium-sized tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is known for its hard, dense wood, which has been historically valued for musical instruments. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to overharvesting, it is also considered a threatened species in some regions.
